Very old/traditional and hierarchical structure that values tenure over innovation and efficiency. Staff in all departments treated at the bottom of the food chain.

review_title: Beautiful place and a warm environment to work in.
job_title: Technical Assistance/Consultant in South Hadley, MA
pros: Great benefits, the campus/environment is beautiful; when you're not working you can go for a walk along one of the two lakes. There's a strong sense of community, so your day-to-day morale is high.
cons: It is a college, so the normal issues of many girls of that age in one spot can be trying at times. Sometimes it can be a little cliquey given the small nature of the campus, so you have to be careful about who you upset or if you start any kind of work-drama.  The winter is harsh too.

job_title: Research Analyst in South Hadley, MA
pros: Working for a mission-driven organization has a lot of upsides - there's always a sense of purpose and meaning in your work.  The organizational culture was also largely positive - the leadership were good people, and did their best to ensure a healthy work environment.
cons: Our department was chronically underresourced while I was there.  Of course, this is typical of almost anywhere with a finite budget, but it could be frustrating at times to always be told to somehow do more with less - less people, fewer tools, etc.

review_title: A beautiful campus and a place to meet wonderful people
job_title: Student Worker in South Hadley, MA
pros: The pay is rather low for the time and energy you put into. However your fellow student workers and staffers are awesome.The people there form an inspiring community. So you will be able to enjoy you time working there.
cons: The winter there is long and harsh. The college is situated in a very tiny remote town without much life. But the work life balance is good if you choose to venture into other parts of the valley

review_title: Working as a computer science TA has been an incredibly rewarding experience.
job_title: Computer Science Teachers Assistant in South Hadley, MA
pros: I like to help students learn computer science because I feel it's important to get more women to try and pursue a career in the comSci field.
cons: it can be challenging to assist students if the lectures given by the professor are not productive.  It can leave too much responsibility on me as a TA.

job_title: Undergraduate Research Intern in South Hadley, MA
pros: You are essentially being paid to attend classes that you would be attending anyway. It is a great way to help your fellow students out while also keeping up with your notes.
cons: Some of cons of this job are that you are often going to need to make your notes more comprehensive than you would otherwise.

job_title: Student Worker in South Hadley, MA
pros:
staff members are always there to answer your questions
you get promotions (and receive higher payment) if your supervisor (a staff member) recognizes your work
cons:
relatively poor communication with the other departments who happens to be working on similar tasks
most student workers, e.g. dining hall student workers, are paid with MA minimum wage; the majority of the rest are paid only a little higher (almost unnoticeable), with only few paid the highest

review_title: Amazing people to work with, and a great atmosphere
job_title: Athletic Trainer in South Hadley, MA
pros: Amazing co workers, always willing to help. Great atmosphere. Worked there as a graduate assistant and everyone was understanding of my course load and willing to adjust my schedule. Note: worked in the dept of  athletics.
cons: The community is very unique and it was slightly difficult fitting in at first but after a while it was a great feeling of comradery.

job_title: Reunions Worker in South Hadley, MA
pros: The reunion faculty is extremely friendly, it's great working with fellow students, it feels like the work you're doing is necessary and important
cons: For some positions such as helping students move out of dorms, I needed to work many extra hours because I was the only one driving the moving van. I was paid, but hadn't expected these extra hours and labor.

job_title: Academic Staff in South Hadley, MA
pros: Love the community here and the students are wonderful.
cons: I have no cons to share.  It is a lovely place to work within my department.  However, I can't comment on other departments.
